lines.text:
[Charles comes down the stoop stairs and sees Claudine sitting there]
I knew it all the time. I knew that nigga was gonna walk out on you. I knew that! It's your own damn fault. That's right- don't blame nobody but yourself! You had the six kids!
That's right! Six kids- that's right! That's all I got in this world- my children.
I knew I had nothing but I have to share what I ain't got.
My son, the black revolutionary. You ain't nothing but a snot-nosed coward. That's what you are.
Yeah, that's right. That's what you want me to be, Mama? Why do you think Francis the way we is? He's being exactly what you want him to be- invisible.
I don't know why you didn't kill me when I was born.
Oh, you talk crazier every day!
If you loved me, you would have killed me like those women back on the plantations. They killed their kids so they wouldn't have to be slaves.
I guess I didn't love my children because I wanted them to live.
Yeah, so you told us to be afraid, right?
You better be afraid! You better be afraid- this world out there will kill you.
How can frightened people change anything?
There ain't no other kind of people, Charles. I'm scared all the time, but I do my job. If you ain't scared, you don't have need for guts.
I'm gonna get some sleep and I'm going to work tomorrow.
Well, as you crawl into bed, you take a look at Charlene's tits. Good night, Grandma.
